mdRecord.dcterms:title: Elms Court, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "As it was originally built in ca. 1836, Elms Court was similar in both design and plan to other large Natchez residences of the period...When it became the residence of Ayers P. Merrill in 1852, Elms Court was enlarged and remodeled to the appearance known today. The north elevation was transformed from its early Greek Revival design to that of a more Romantic villa...With the completion of the ca. 1852 remodeling, Elms Court assumed what is substantially its present-day appearance." added to the National Register of Historic Places in December 1977--National Register of Historic Places nomination form: https://www.apps.mdah.ms.gov/nom/prop/2101.pdf [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
